title: Anivia is ruined
body:
My most favourite champion, Anivia, is now completely ruined.

I understand the reasoning for her changes. like making q stun scale (instead of constant 1.0, +.1 per level), making it more rewarding to hit the stun and more impactful later in the game but her ult is what MAKES anivia. Now she is completely broken and not in the good way. Her ult is what was crucial in every single ability she has. Max range ult would just barely hit people, slowing them enough for you to wall them at max range or hit q with the very tip. Now that her ult has been so badly nerfed her whole kit is less than satisfactory. 

Reason why I believe they would change her ult to grow - wave clear is too strong and distance was too overwhelming perhaps? But honestly it has been completely gutted. She strives when the opposing team is out of position and now, she feels so under-tuned to what her identity was. Slow burst mage that capitalizes on positioning.

 A reasonable fix to her ult  would be to double the rate of expansion. It takes 3 seconds to fully grow from 150 to 550 radius (was 400 before). to cast her ult is 75 mana, per second is 50 mana. It takes 225 mana for it to be full size. The problem isnt the mana its the rate at which it grows. Most fights you will never let the storm go full size because of 1. Kiting, 2. CC (any form of CC will interrupt her ult) 3. Cooldown doesnt start until you cancel your ult. In my opinion, her ult should grow to full radius in 2 seconds, cooldown START on cast, and keep "Final Form" but reduce the AP ratio on her ultimate.

If the above isnt ideal then perhaps just change the starting radius from 150 to 300, reaches full 550 radius in 2.5 seconds (instead of 3). Reduce ap ratio on ultimate.

Or possibly change the full radius to 650 radius in the full 3 seconds with reduced ap ratio.

Reference.
" new FINAL FORM At maximum size, Glacial Storm’s damage, chill duration and slow are increased by 50% "


What are your thoughts?

Thank you,

1. R now also grounds any targets inside of it (seperate effect from the chill)
2. If you land a critical E while R is channeling R will instantly grow to full size
3. R at full size also prevents targets from dashing through it (think poppy W)

The changes I have proposed will make anivia able to skillfully outplay her opponent while still giving counter play but make her abilities feel rewarding for properly using them

R would now have a way to instantly grow if you can land the small radius R or Q, then E while R is channeling to make it instantly grow, and it is now an effective "my zone" tool for anivia because while inside of it she will have faster MS than her enemy due to the slow and they cannot dash on her

Also note the instant growth requires at least 2 spells to cause and if you dodge her R she now has to use her defensive utility Q to try and make E crit for the instant growth

If R+E is the problem, fix E. If you really want to address the burst, that is what you fix. Because E has one purpose and one purpose only: burst, when combined with Q or R. 

Her ultimate, on the other hand, is incredibly flexible. It can be used to: set up an area of damage in a teamfight, clear minion waves, slow retreating or approaching enemies, set up her burst combo, or deny an area to enemies.

After these changes, it is no longer useful at most of those things: it can clear minion waves only after you let it grow (at enormous mana cost), it can no longer reliably slow retreating or approaching enemies, and it can no longer reliably set up her burst combo.

All it's good for now is creating a "set it and forget it" area, that can still be disrupted if the enemy hits her with any CC.

TL;DR: If you think Anivia's burst was too high, her E is the real culprit, not the R. And they didn't really touch her E.
